content.description: Initial content for the file (if created)

path.description: File path (relative to workspace root, can include folders)

append.description: If true, append content to the file instead of overwriting.

createIfNotExist.description: If true and 'append' is set, the file will be created and written if it does not exist. If false, append will only work if the file already exists.

rules.description: Optional rules that must be met for the file to be created. If omitted, file is always created if missing. Supported rule types: 'fileNotExists', 'envVarSet', 'fileExistsGlob', 'folderExists', 'settingEquals', 'fileContains', 'workspaceName'. 'fileExistsGlob' checks if any file matching the glob exists in the workspace (e.g., '*.csproj'). 'folderExists' checks for a folder, 'settingEquals' checks a VS Code setting, 'fileContains' checks if a file contains a string, 'workspaceName' matches the workspace folder name.

value.description: Value for the rule (e.g., file name, env var name, etc.)

description: Automatically configures project settings and environment for optimal development in VS Code.
name: auto-configurator

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
